snippet: On the television show “Regards Croisés,” Haitians lampoon the class divisions in their society and offer a chance for comic relief.
abstract: Alessandra Stanley The TV Watch column explores the unlikely success of the sketch-comedy television program Regards Croises in Haiti; says that show gently lampoons daily Haitian life, particularly the country's class divides and crushing hardships.
lead_paragraph: On the television show “Regards Croisés,” Haitians lampoon the class divisions in their society and offer a chance for comic relief.

headline.seo: ‘Regards Croisés’ Offers Haiti Needed Comic Relief on TV
headline.main: On Haitian TV, Masses Laugh at Other Half
headline.print_headline: Haiti’s Masses Enjoy the Taste Of Comic Relief
